references.paper_title: Towards a theory of non-log-concave sampling: first-order stationarity guarantees for Langevin Monte Carlo
references.reason: This paper provides foundational theoretical results on non-log-concave sampling, which is directly relevant to the central problem addressed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Linear convergence bounds for diffusion models via stochastic localization
references.reason: This paper offers improved convergence analysis for diffusion models, which are the foundation for the proposed denoising diffusion Monte Carlo (DDMC) framework.

references.paper_title: Sampling is as easy as learning the score: theory for diffusion models with minimal data assumptions
references.reason: This paper provides important theoretical guarantees for score-based generative modeling, which is crucial for understanding the theoretical underpinnings of DDMC.

references.paper_title: Localization schemes: A framework for proving mixing bounds for Markov chains
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel framework for analyzing the mixing time of Markov chains, a critical aspect for evaluating the efficiency of sampling algorithms like ZOD-MC.
This paper proposes the Reverse Diffusion Monte Carlo (RDMC) algorithm, which is closely related to the proposed ZOD-MC and serves as a benchmark for comparison.
